Not only did I get my sandwich but it was really good and portion made for two, and not expensive. 

Two "nights" later, we were there again. Another friendly waiter, this time my friend and I shared a burger - he even split it for us, and we each got our share of fries. 

Yes good food is obviously important, and they do have it, but good service is also a must to make us "fans".

Went here for breakfast since I was staying at the Luxor and I didn't want to stop at Starbucks. Nothing really spectacular here, had the "Healthy Choice" which is scrambled eggs, veggies, with a side of fruit. Food was good and got me on my way. Staff was super friendly.

I've always avoided eating at the Luxor  because their restaurant lineup never appealed to me. But, decided to give their cafe a shot with a friend after checking out their menu. They offer plenty of standard breakfast and lunch fare, but the standout dishes reside in their diverse selection of French toast. They don't just add different toppings to the same bread. They utilize different types to create the best profile.

Despite the lack of carrots in the carrot cake French toast, the bread was soaked through with custard and topped with garnishes that added a nice variety of tastes and textures to make it a standout dish. Likewise, the strawberry shortcake French toast was an enticing array of flavors highlighted by the strawberry compote. Lighter, overall, than the carrot cake, it was equally as good.

Less successful were red velvet pancakes that had a tough, almost rubbery texture and icing that was thick and grainy. However, the hints of caramel were a nice touch. Their monte cristo was a solid rendition with an exterior providing plenty of crunch. It could have benefited from more ham, but the flavors were still decent.

With a menu full of items that are more likely to satisfy than impress, it's the specialty items like the French toast that should be ordered for a memorable meal.

4 Stars

After arriving to LV late night (9pm), most of the buffetts are already closed.  We just wanted someplace close to have a quick meal before getting some rest.  We should've walked further!

We've already knew we're in for a bad day when we were sat right at the entrance.  We asked for something inside (it was pretty quiet in the inside), but was told it's full.  We looked at the menu and all 6 guys ordered the prime rib ($19).  I figured, what the hell since I wasn't paying for it (one of the guys hit an $1800 jackpot before we arrived and buying dinner).  I order medium cook.  When the rib arrived, it was cooked completely through making the rib tough.  service was pretty slow, except when giving the bill (They were QUICK!)

Next time, I would rather eat Exalibur's Dogfood buffett than come here.  (Don't get me wrong, Exalibur's Dogfood buffett isn't cheap either.  It's running for $17!!!!.....probably McDonald would be the best option!
Good omelette and friendly staff.  Right in the Luxor so very convenient    Open breakfast and lunch.   Good variety of selections

My scrambled eggs were watery and not cooked all the way. My waffle was too thin and too crispy if that's even a bad thing for some . I would cut through the waffle and it would fall apart in many pieces not allowing me to get a good bite. It ended up looking like mashed potatoes. As for the flavor it wasn't as sweet as I like and seemed abit salty. Didn't get any flavor of an actual waffle. On the other hand my boyfriend had an egg white omelet that came with potatoes that were really good. Nice seasoning/ flavor from his dish.

Nothing to really rave about. Very simple no frills food and slightly overpriced.

I ordered a Black Forest Ham sandwich. When it was served, my first thought was "This is it?" It wasn't very big, but tasted alright. The dried tomato in it was a nice touch. It's served with a choice of cole slaw, baked potato or fries. I had it with the fries which weren't oily. So that's a good thing. 

I looked at what my friend's wife ordered and wished I ordered what she had which was the salmon. Again, it didn't look like much. Just a piece of fish on yellow rice. It did look like a good slice of fish. I can't remember what my friend ordered. 

They also serve breakfast all day. I thought about ordering that, but since I was leaving the next day, I had planned on taking in a breakfast buffet in the morning. 

Service wasn't very friendly. The lady who took our order had a pretty much "Whaddya want" type attitude. The intonation in her voice when she check on us made me afraid to ask for a refill on my drink. 

Really nothing special except being with the company I was with. I hadn't seen him in years and it was good catching up on life with him.

We were very impressed with the Pyramid Cafe, as were many other people judging by the long lines. I definitely recommend having a reservation. Personally, I loved the cinnamon role french toast but I'll use any excuse to eat dessert for breakfast. Everything on the menu looked devious though and our server was very friendly. Bonus is that it isn't too expensive for strip food. Negatives are the long lines and the fact that they aren't open past lunch time. Honestly, if they were, this place would be packed 24/7.

I really wasn't in the mood for a buffet so I walked right past the one in the Excalibur on my way to see what Luxor had in the way of a coffee shop.  I wanted food cooked to order for me.  My food came out really fast.  I would be real surprised if any of it did not come from a warming tray.  The eggs were watery, the corned beef hash was dried out, I could only deal with part of the potatoes, the toast served wrapped in a basket was too cold even when it first got there to melt the butter.  The orange juice was really good and the decaf was ok.  

The service was good and friendly.  The chairs were comfortable to lounge back in but not very comfortable to sit up to the table in.

Overall I was not really impressed paying $5 more plus tip for the same quality of food I could have gotten from the buffet.

Good Cafe inside the Luxor. Shared a Reuben Sandwich with fries and a cup of clam chowder.

We finished it all if that says anything more.

There's a discount coupon in your welcome package if you're staying in the hotel.

So we arrived at the Luxor late on a Monday night and the only thing open was this Pyramid Cafe - their 24 hour place.  We waited in line at midnight for over 20 minutes.  When we were seated, our drink order was taken right away, but we waited about 15 minutes for a server to come over.  It wasn't all that busy, but there were only 2-3 servers on duty and a schmuck of a manager strolled around not helping very much.  He should have taken off his jacket and got his hands dirty.  

I ordered onion soup and M had pizza.  The food tasted okay, not bad, but not great.  It definitely wasn't worth the wait.  The food was overpriced (ya, I know, it's Vegas).  Next time we will drive somewhere to eat late.

Not the breakfast I was looking for. For an overpriced breakfast, our food came out of the kitchen piecemeal and that several different temperatures, none of which were hot. The coffee was good but we had to keep waiting for a cup to be refilled. I had the pancakes and they were quite lackluster and flavorless. My eggs were good, but the toast was cold and unbuttered.

If you are looking for a good breakfast before you head out of the hotel, the better choice is to go to the deli. Much better food, much quicker service.

For what it is, you can't beat it. We woke up a little hungover and weren't ready to take on a massive buffet and spend $100 so we strolled over to Pyramid Cafe. 5 min wait, friendly staff, standard diner food (they did offer mimosas and bloody mary's). For his eggs benedict and my 2 eggs breakfast with some coffees it was like $25 (a steal in Vegas!) I would return again.
Would leave 0 stars if i could. Have been waiting for over 25 minutes for someone to take our order. Poor service.

Pretty good, quick and fairly cheap by Vegas standards.

I can't really say anything bad about this place.  Lots of choices on the menu and tastes good too.  Far superior to places that purport to be classier and are located in higher end spots  (e.g., Red, White and Blue at Mandalay Bay).

Definitely a cute Cafe. It's in the middle of the Luxor, so once you find it, not a bad deal. The prices are reasonable, but the food was sort of hit or miss. 

We had the French onion soup, which was very tasty and not too salty. Nice broth, soft, flavorful onions, and just the right amount of gooey Swiss cheese. 

The pizza was average. We got  pepperoni and it was quite greasy. I can deal with it as I love any pizza, but I have to admit, probably not the best I've had by a long shot.

The service was wonderful, as they were attentive, kind and ready to explain the menu. 

If you want a quick bite while staying at the Luxor, this may be a serviceable option.

This place is alright. If you get something scrambled and likely the pancakes(looked good but I didn't order any. Neighbors seemed to like them.) 

Service was good and our server was attentive and helpful. 

Food was .... sad. I ordered 'The Benedict' and the potatoes are actually deep fried not home fries like I thought. The hollandaise sauce was way too salty and the eggs had no salt at all. The bread wasn't toasted and it was cold. 

My mom got the philly omelet which was actually decent but not an omelet more of a scramble. Her toast was just warmed bread, no actual crunch or anything. Again the potatoes are fried.

Our server, Jennifer, was very nice and actually noticed our dislike of the potatoes and swapped it with fruit also offered to let us try the grapefruit juice to see if we liked it before ordering. Overall she made it an endurable experience regardless I will not return.

We ordered the skillet breakfast, pancakes, ham breakfast and let's just say there was no talking at the table! Unless our awesome waiter Derek came by to check on us, in which case there was tons of talking. Probably the nicest, friendliest servers I've ever had. He really made our breakfast experience just that much better. But seriously the food was AWESOME! Service was great! Can't go wrong!
Each of our breakfast selection was good and fulfilling. The best was that it was 24 hours and in house if you are staying in Luxor. One of the sweet places on the step with nice ambience.

Had my hangover breakfast here. 

Everything was just fine except the scrambled eggs. . . . they were strange & fake like?? Not sure how you can screw up scrambled eggs so I am taking 2 stars off for that. 

Service was excellent and so were the pancakes.

If you're trying to redeem a myVEGAS comp mimosa or Bloody Mary drink reward, make sure mLife give you a slip or voucher. They will not accept your mLife card. 

After my breakfast, I had to walk back and stand in the mLife line for another 30 minutes to get the slip. The supervisor at mLife said Pyramid cafe should've called mLife desk instead of having me walked over and waited in line. 

When I handed the slip to the Pyramid cafe supervisor and told what mLife said, she said they still needed the slip. Either I have to get it or mLife rep walk over with the slip. Both mLife and Pyramid Cafe had very poor customer service. 

Not only that, when I was dining in the cafe, I wasn't even finished with my corned beef hash and the server just grabbed my plate. She didn't even ask me if I was done eating. I thought that was very rude. I didn't say anything at the time because I was disappointed in their corned beef hash anyways. It was dry. Tasted like the canned ones. I thought it would've been different with real corned beef but it wasn't. 

Will not return.

This was another place my fiance and I ate simply out of convenience. We had a free stay at Luxor and came here for breakfast just before we went off to something we had planned. It wasn't a premeditated decision - we just wanted a quick bite to eat. 

We ordered the Breakfast Combo and Eggs Benedict. Both dishes were mediocre, at best, and reminded us of Denny's which we're also not fans of. I wouldn't come here again, even out of convenience.
Decent coffee, decent oatmeal, decent hash browns. Nothing special, service wasn't great either.

First time here...Had a craving for pancakes and their portion was just perfect to compliment the rest of the food on The Combination breakfast. The atmosphere was nice at 9:30am for a Saturday morning! No wait at that time but surely enough at 10am the line was long to check in! Love the different sitting options:regular tables, booths, or an adorable table with large live seat! Good choices from classics to healthy...in case you need to rehydrate for you upcoming day! Hostess we sure to mention the alcoholism beverages available LOL! Coffee cup was continuously filled. Waiter Dante was superb! He was attentive and timely.

Only ate here because I had comp dollars for the hotel so it was free. I would not spend my actual money here. The "breakfast" is mediocre, especially for the price. Eggs were rubbery and the pancakes I had to saw through. Vegas is too big to settle for a place like this, do yourself a favor and try experiencing another restaurant. I suggest the other restaurants in Luxor or the food court. Not worth trying this place at all, maybe the lunch is better but as far as the breakfast goes.... don't bother. I normally try to find the good in places but not here.

Friendly prompt service, a fair price and tasty food. If you are staying at the Luxor and need breakfast, give the pyramid cafe a chance. 

I ordered the French Toast and my wife had a bagel with Cream Cheese. 

Was it the best I ever had, no. 
Was it tasty, hot, and reasonably priced, yes. 

You do not go here for gourmet but you will get good food and a friendly server.

Ridiculously understaffed, they had our server Deborah waiting all the tables in the room and it took her over 25 minutes for her to come to our table to take our order. I'm willing to pay $16.00 for a breakfast burrito but I shouldn't have to wait that long to order a simple burrito.  Then waited 35 minutes to bring the food, total of 60 minutes to get a breakfast burrito for $16, not to mention the $5 orange juice. Won't be coming back.

Worst breakfast ever, hashbrown is oily, steak is chewy. Won't come back again.
The staff is nice.

I enjoyed the food. Good portions, made properly, no complaints there. 

The BIG issue we had with this place was the service. The hostesses were nice, and accommodating since we requested a booth and they needed to have one cleaned for us. It was also extremely crowded, but that's to be expected to where we are. The tables aren't too close together, so it's not extremely distracting or anything with noise or people. 

But our waitress was very frank and not attentive at all. She put in our orders and drinks then never came back. Empty glasses, empty plates, just completely ignored. She wasn't very friendly at all, no smile or anything, and seemed irritated when we asked for refills or more sauces. 

Would probably not eat in here again, but I would order to go or room service. The food was very good.
The Pyrimid Cafe is only open for breakfast and lunch.   The food is good; and interesting healthy choices are on the menu. The staff is pleasant and attentive.

"grilled cheese search"

So the gay boyfriend and I stumbled in here late Sunday night in search of grilled cheese. It's not on the menu but if you ask nicely, they will make it for you for $7.99.

I ordered the chicken noodle soup and the San Francisco club. The soup was so-so. There was a lot of chicken and maybe this was slightly healthier than a canned soup? The sandwich was way too bready and by the end of the meal, I was eating just the filling (turkey was very salty but the bacon was thick!).

With two drinks, our bill topped out around $40 after tax and tip.

Probably not worth a sober meal but I think it saved us from a morning of a horrible hangover.

We stayed at the Luxor for our wedding/honeymoon/vacation. We ended up eating here pretty much every morning before starting our day, and it was a good way to wake up. The staff there was really friendly the entire time (except one lady, who was actually too friendly and a bit touchy feely for us) and our food came quickly. Coffee was average diner coffee-- Folgers in your cup kind of deal. The food was pretty basic, but a good portion and a good value for the money, and they always brought the check out quickly as well. It saved us time-- and if you are in the hotel, it's the way to go for breakfast.

What a disappointment to find out that they no longer are open 24 hours.  I wanted some lunch and to my surprise they are now limited on the hours open.  That resorted us into eating at the horrible Public House for lunch after that 5 hour drive to Vegas I was hungry.  So the Luxor has no options food wise for Lunch or Dinner.  

This Café being closed and the quality of the rooms going down hill at the Luxor has made me not want to come back to stay or eat anymore.

meh.
the turkey avocado sandwich on a ciabata was decent, but not eye-popping and satisfying. it did what it was supposed to do. fill me up. i ate more of the fries, though. the french onion soup is EXTREMELY salty and pretty disappointing. the best part of the soup was the melting swiss cheese. even that wasn't done correctly. it was already cold when it got to our table.

 there's nothing great or unique about this cafe. your basic diner food but they charge $14 for an omelette.  i honestly didn't appreciate the prices. even in NY you can find cheaper deals. the portions were good enough. like i mentioned, nothing to really impress anyone. i think i should have gone to little caesar's upstairs in the food court and only spend $2.99 on crazy bread. 

the service is okay. she didn't really follow any of our directions on how to split the bill or our orders.

We actually ate here twice, lunch on Sunday and Breakfast on Monday.  Food was ok.  What loses a star is the cost.  It is overpriced for what you get -- I  guess I was thinking that being Vegas it would be more reasonable.  Granted, I was thinking Denny's prices.  The salad was good, but very basic - a lot of lettuce, chicken, lettuce ... you get the picture..  The breakfast was good.   Our server had brought out the preservatives that I wanted (Raspberry) instead of telling me that it wasn't available - so yeah for that!

Great service, Great food, Great Price.

I had a large group of people with me and the staff were attentive in all of our needs. We were seated in 10 mins, drinks came out immediately, food came out in about 25 mins.  Portions were decent, worth the price.  Not a lot of 24hour cafe's have good service like this so I would come here again if I stayed close to the Luxor.

This restaurant is located in the back of the Luxor Hotel and Casino. It is by the pool and sport/horses betting area. In general this restaurant can be compared to a Denny's or Bob Evans but a bit worse. The waitress wasn't great; however, her busser was amazing. This is a below average restaurant with below average food. My plate was a little overpriced for how buttery my eggs were (drenched in butter and oil) and how soggy the hash browns were. My boyfriend's steak and eggs looked appetizing but didn't exactly hit the mark. In my opinion the restaurant is overpriced, poorly decorated, slowly falling apart and prepares below average food.
Small menu but good. Nice waitress. Had burger and fries. Good. Wait was normal. Not fast but not slow. I do think that earning points on the M card should get u more like a free meal here.
Exactly what they say it is. Simple, good food. Good service. No surprises. Coffee isn't great so grab a Starbucks to bring with.

La mejor opción para desayunos y brunch del hotel Luxor, me encantaron sus platos para desayunar son Gigantes!!! Y de gran sabor. Una atención dedicada de los servers y servicio de cocina súper rápido. En mi opinión una relación precio-calidad mucho mejor que el propio buffet del hotel

Great service. My breakfast was good except my hash browns were mostly cold and barely cooked. The eggs and toast were great and we were seated quickly even tho the restaurant was packed. Very nice waitresses and hostess.

Luxor's late night greasy spoon. Well, that is when I frequented this spot as a guest of the Luxor during times I was too lazy (and drunk) to go any place else for late night eats.

It's good for what it is. The servers make sure your drink is full and you get your food within a reasonable time.

I had the burger with the blue cheese on one late night. It was good, yet forgettable.

Another day later, I came here for lunch and had their spaghetti with meatballs. For the price and location, this place serves up some great traditional Americana spaghetti and meatballs. I liked it a lot.
Yuck, food is so gross here. I guess you get what you pay for because Aria cafe is so much expensive but the food is so much better

Yes, this place is overpriced. You're eating in the hotel; that's to be expected. 

Still, for $13.99 (which was about $7 too much), I was able to wolf down scrambled eggs, a heaping mound of bacon, hash browns, and a small stack of silver dollar pancakes. Made for a nice hearty breakfast. Quality would be comparable to Denny's, maybe slightly better. 

You eat here for the convenience of not having to slog out down The Strip looking for somewhere to grub after a long night of enjoying Vegas. In that respect, it's your best bet if you happen to be staying here. 

We didn't imbibe, but they've got $5 Bloody Mary's and mimosas. Great deal if you need a little hair of the dog to get your ass moving.

This is the third time I've eaten at a 24 hour cafe in a Strip property in the last two weeks. This time, we ate here after going to the Barenaked Ladies concert at the Mandalay Bay Beach. Initially, we were going to do the Red White & Blue in Mandalay Bay, but I almost passed out at the prices and lack of veggie options. Having visited Pyramid Cafe once before when I first moved to Las Vegas, we decided to make the trek to the Luxor. Scanning the menu I was bombarded with options for vegetarians, from breakfast to entrees to apps, I had a lot of choices and wouldn't have to ask for a lot of substitutions. I ordered the nachos (holy crap it was a huge plate filled to the brim with beans, pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream and guacamole), everyone else at the table had breakfast, and we shared onion rings. There would have been no way I could have finished the nachos. What I liked best about them is that the PC uses real cheese. I've had fake cheese on nachos plenty of times at other cafes, but there was at least two types of shredded cheese used to make this plate. 
After having mediocre experiences at other cafe's, I will definitely hit this one up again...

Not fancy, but good breakfast spot if you're staying close, and if you're not, breakfast served until 1pm. The French toast was delicious. The hashbrowns weren't worth $3.99 for the little side plate. The caprese shrimp salad was decent. Seating was immediate at noon on a Monday. Would come here again for the French toast.
This is a decent place to eat late at night and the price was good for cafe.   I had the american breakfast with eggs, hash brown and ham.

What a disappointment! Have had lots of trouble finding restaurants who will honor gluten-free cooking since we got to town 2 days ago. To that end, I googled gf restaurants and Pyramid Cafe was listed predominantly as a place to go. They had not one thing listed on the menu. When I asked our waitress, she offered they had gf bread but nothing else. Really?
Not only was our food really lame and tasteless, the coffee was cold and part of my husband's order was forgotten. If you don't have gf options and aren't in any way willing to accommodate such dietary restrictions, dont advertise that you are GF.  It irritates people! We certainly will bypass this restaurant in the future.

Fast service and the grilled ham and cheese was decent too.  They charged $9 for a mimosa and $9 for a split of champagne so I ordered the split and asked for a small glass of OJ.  So basically I got two mimosa for the price of one.

Whoo hoo!

I came here with my husband on a Sunday for breakfast. He had the cinnabon french toast which was great. I had the lox with poached eggs which was amazing. It came with soooo much salmon, yum. The drinks were HUGE, delicious and reasonably priced. Will definitely be returning on the next trip.

There are not a lot of options for food at 4am at this end of the strip.  I was worried we would have to wait forever for our food and the service would be horrible.  To my surprise the server was friendly and pretty good.  The food was ok and it came out pretty quickly.  I ordered chicken strips and fries so it was not too complicated.

I would not normally eat here, but for late night food it is just fine.

Went here with our $35 room credit to Pyramid Cafe, Tender Steakhouse, Rice Company, or the MORE Buffet. I didn't want the buffet because I knew I'd over eat and neither did my aunt. We decided on this place around 11 AM.

The line was long, but my aunt, mother, and father were already waiting at our table. My brother and I arrived about 11, but my sister and her fiance were late! COME ON SISSY!!!

Anyway, the service was horrendous. Lizzy came with water and I had arrived with coffee in my cup which was nice (since my mom knew I'd have some). Had to ask for refills of water and coffee.

We had a huge order and I got the angus steak, eggs, and cottage cheese. I was supposed to get rye bread (didn't) and fruit (being healthy) gets an upcharge/can't be subbed. Why, why Las Vegas do you fault me for wanting more fiber, less simple sugar, and more nutrients? I don't get you!

Thank goodness for the room credit. Wouldn't have gone if I didn't have it!

The food is pretty damn good, and the wait staff is very friendly. They also pop back in a lot to re-fill the coffee which is great in my book!

The first day I got the peanut butter french toast with bananas, the second I got the carrot cake french toast with cream cheese topping, and the last day  I got egg whites with veggies. The first two items were very rich, but excellent. I am glad I splurged. I also really enjoyed this place a lot more than the buffet in the Luxor.

Good cafe food and great customer service! Three different people kept asking us if we wanted refills on our drinks. Other restaurants don't even come back. It's not fancy but hey I would definitely eat here again :) And they have pretty good prime rib!

Service here was awful.  I ended up going to get my own water multiple times.   Breakfast burrito was good, but opened it up and almost nooooo chorizo.     The waiter told me i was supposed to order extra chorizo and new chef to blame .   Bulllllll!    Terrible!

Traveled from Houston, Texas....we was staying at the Luxor and was looking for somewhere to eat breakfast.

We walked around the casino and found this restaurant...the location was not bad, it's hard to miss. The line was pretty long but the wait went fast. The hostess was nice and seated people quickly, personally is my favorite type of hostess because it reminded me of myself back in the gap lol. 

I ordered the Churro Waffle. One word AMAZING!!! The cinnamon sugar goodness just melts in your mouth with the whipped cream on top. It was too good! I really enjoyed it along with the stripes of bacon! 

I tried a piece of my mom's buttermilk pancakes! That was also amazing, nice, thick and fluffy. The service was quick however we had to keep reminding the server to bring a bottle a water, but one of the other servers retrieved the water without even charging! GREAT!!

Would recommend this place! Food was too flavorful, can't beat that!

If I could give this place a 1/2 star I would. SLOW, SLOW, SLOW service. Took 20 mins just to get the waitress to come over and take our drinks. Food was so so, it was incredibly overpriced and very badly decorated. I paid $57 for 5 of us to eat really bad food with really horrible service. The Luxor should post a warning sign before you enter.

We had breakfast here at the pyramid café had a lot of good reviews but seem like the service was a bit rushed and took a long time to get the food out to us and it was just OK nothing special was not horrible would probably go somewhere else next time
Outstanding breakfast.  I kept it simple today with the bacon, eggs and toast. The portions were nice and Stephanie was an excellent server.  Great start to the morning.
Came here for bfast and it wasn't bad.  Nothing extraordinary.  Staff was nice though.

I had a major issue with this place. Sure, it is Vegas and sure people get drunk, however it was 9:00 and hearing people yelling across the restaurant isn't a good thing. I asked for the manager and she gave us an attitude when I said that they need to do something about it. She said they aren't drunk (though the table was filled with empty bottles of beer and other alcohol containers. The menu is just ok and the prices are HIGH for what you get. The manager finally started getting more complaints about the obnoxious drunks and she comped us two drinks so that was cool, but I doubt I will go back here.

Better than expected.
  We were originally going to eat upstairs in Nathan's. Due to the food court refurbishment in progress, Nathan's is temporary closed. Up for a convenient meal that was not going to cost a fortune, we tried the Pyramid Cafe.
  I expected mediocre food with sketchy service. On the contrary, the Pyramid Cafe classic cheeseburger was thick and juicy. The fries were tasty. The waitress was on top of beverage refills. 
  Although the Pyramid Cafe exceeded my expectations, I am still not a fan. A major reason is that I could get better value at off strip casino cafes. Or Denny's. I did not see salad or soup offered with the entres. For a Strip casino cafe, the prices are not outrageous. It is my understanding that the Pyramid Cafe is the least expensive casino cafe on the South Strip [south of Paris]. Fries are included in the price of the sandwich. 
   Pyramid Cafe is a good casino cafe that exceeded my expectations. Knowing that there are better casino cafe values in Las Vegas, I am not a fan.

We stayed at The Luxor (mistake #1) and found this place to be the only restaurant in the hotel to get some eggs and bacon (to order) to clear up the hangover.  We went twice while we were in Vegas.  Here's why it sucked:

1)  The line is so so long even though more than half the tables were completely open.  They just refused to sit us.
2)  The service is TERRIBLE.  When I asked for waters the waitress rolled her eyes at me and disappeared for ten minutes.
3)  Poached eggs came in a small dish on the side, swimming in water.  While blotting the eggs on a napkin, my yolk broke.  That just sucks.
4)  We ordered turkey sausage and they brought greasy pork sausage.  When I pointed that out, the waitress told me we were wrong and that it was obviously turkey.  No. Pork.
5)  Underseasoned and bland hash browns.  

What's good:

1)  Uhm... bacon.  Bacon is always good.

For what this place charges and for it being the only real breakfast spot in the hotel, I wished for a lot more.  Thankfully, I'll never step foot into the Luxor again after our experience which means I'll never have to eat at the Pyramid Cafe again.

While this is just your standard hotel cafe, this place fails on all counts.  Over the years I have stayed at the Luxor a lot, and every time it always seems to be the same problem, and the only reason this place continues to get my business is because when I eat there I am normally hung over and don't want to mess with anything else.

I have only ever ate here for breakfast, but the food is always consistently pretty bad, and the service is always pretty terrible.  This last trip I got an omelet that was smothered with way to much cheese, and for being a steak omelet, it has about 3 small pieces of steak inside, that tastes like it was microwaved.  I got some toast with my omelet and it tasted like it was 10 days past its prime, and I couldn't even eat it.

The servers always seem to be rude here, and are in no hurry to take your order, and in even less of a hurry to bring it out to you.  Does everyone at the table want their food brought out at the same time?  Better not hold your breath, that is another thing they aren't in a hurry to do either.

After driving to Vegas was hungry at 1am so we decided to eat here since open 24 hours.
Service was rather slow and people that sat after us was helped before us.  Only after I flagged down a manager and asked did someone come to take our drink orders and then our server came to take our order.

I had the Corned Beef Reuben sandwich which was not that good but I ate it cause I was starving.  Its Vegas and there are PLENTY of other places that have much better Reuben sandwiches.
Breakfast all day and awesome service! Great spot to re-fuel and rest up after pounding the pavement in Vegas!

All I had were their nachos, and they were the BEST. Huge portion too! My ex and I loved em! Gotta get back here. Sure you'll wanna eat somewhere else...but if you're drunk and hungry and at the Luxor, get these Chicken Nachos!

We had breakfast here on Monday and I thought everything was wonderful.  We didn't have to wait to be seated.  As soon as we sat down someone came over and took our drink orders.  The waitress came over shortly after and took our order, she was very pleasant.  Our food came very quickly.  We both got omelets and they were huge!  They came with a big helping of hash browns and 3 pieces of toast each.  We couldn't finish it all.  Everything was delicious.  The only bad thing I can say is the hash browns were a little too salty.  I felt the price was fair for what we received.

Was here for lunch one day waiting for another family member and service was pretty bad. We ourselves came late, coming from another hotel to meet some people that were staying here. 

When we arrived the waitress was giving us attitude about how it wasn't her section; like the sections could be clearly seen. When we ordered our food, we also needed some boxes because a couple had to leave. The boxes took so long that they finished their food before the boxes arrived. 

The sausages were overly salty, eggs and hash browns had no flavor. And even the coffee tasted kind of watery.

Price about what you would expect at a strip hotel cafe. We ate twice on our trip here. I had the steel cut oats both times and the price on those was good. No kids menu so both of my kids had regular order of pancakes on first breakfast here. They should have shared one and still would have had one pancake left over. Took the leftovers and used them as snacks as we walked the strip. The second visit they shared a plate.

I'm so glad I found this place.  All the times I have been in the Luxor and I have never noticed it...I'm a little disappointed in myself.  Came here for brunch Saturday, ordered the tuna salad sandwich (not something I typically order at a restaurant ever) but something was telling me to order it....and I am so glad I did.  It was the most amazing tuna salad I have ever had.  I also got the coleslaw for a side and that too was delicious.  I also had a bite of my friends fish and chips....just as tasty!  Everyone at the table was beyond please with their dishes, so in the future I will definitely make my way over to this nice cafe.  The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because of the service....granted it was Saturday near lunch hour....but no personality whatsoever...came and ran (literally, so he was hustling)...but breath, slow down a minute and enjoy your friendly customers.

Honestly I don't know what everyone is complaining about, the breakfast I had here last week with some of my friends was very good and the service friendly.  Sure it wasn't the quicket meal but if you want fast service in Vegas go out of the hotels.   The idea here is to keep you in the cafe while you soak in the sounds of those ever-spinning slots and people cheering/jeering along with it.  This makes you relax and enjoy your meal and that you can afford it.   I had some great blueberry pancakes with sliced bananas and fresh strawberries on top.  Very good.

My husband and I were so buffeted out when we wandered in here, that probably anything would have tasted good. We ordered burgers, me with red wine caramelized onions and bleu cheese and him some sort of pepper jack jalapeno thing. We both got onion rings. 
Those had to be some of the best burgers we'd ever had. Maybe it was because of all the buffet food, I don't know, but I know, now that I'm home that I'm craving that burger again.
Nice waitress, crappy lemonade, and no lines! I'd go again for that burger alone!
awesome late night food after hours of dancing/clubbing through vegas.

Since the Excalibur decided that having a cafe for breakfast was not a good idea we ventured into the Luxor and came across the Pyramid Cafe. Unfortunately they close after lunch time so they are not a 24 hour operation which is most unfortunate because the food they offer would be perfect for late night eats. No matter I guess at least they offered early morning breakfast. I forget the name of the dish I ordered but it was a basic breakfast of eggs, sausage, hashbrowns, and toast. The eggs and sausage were good but the hasbrowns and toast left something to be desired. I liked the decor of the place. The Luxor does a phenomenal job of staying true to their theme. The prices are typical Vegas, which is you pay more than you usually would for something, so I have different price expectations for them. My breakfast was around $9 and for Vegas that is pretty typical so it does not bother me. I expect t spend more money to dine out on vacation then I would at home especially at restaurants in Vegas casinos. There are cheaper dining options on the strip like a Dennys or Cocos so if I did not like these prices I could go elsewhere so I don't feel like I have the right to complain too much about that. The food here was nothing special but it was not disgusting either. Our waitress MaryEllen was a sweetheart and she had great customer service. She made sure we had everything we needed at all times. I ordered a milk and she forgot to bring it out to me and when I reminded her she was very apologetic and made up for it. To her defense the place was packed and she was working alot of tables. The food took a little long to come out but it was very busy that morning.  Overall the place is just basic. Nothing remarkable. I plan to stay at the Luxor on another trip to Vegas and when I do I would say I will eat here again I just think I will choose another selection for my meal.

Open 24 hours.  Problem with it, you have to walk through the smoking to get to the non smoking area and it isn't separated very well.  Food is just ok, ok quantity and the staff seems tired and crankie and overworked.  Located on the first floor towards the pool.

I had the Yin and Yang, not disappointing. I really like Eggs Benedict, so this gave me half that and a country style eggs Benedict. Both were good but I think next time we're going with the classic. Eggs were cooked perfectly for everyone. Dante & Pollard were awesome and very attentive. $50, 2 breakfasts, coffee, & 2 Bloody Mary's to chase the hang over. Will be back!!

Finally was able to make it to the Pyramid the day we were leaving.  Oh how I wish they were open 24hrs, we would have eaten here every day.  I was pretty tired and hungover, so not much appetite, but the bagel and cream cheese hit the spot. Everyone else's food looked great, too.  The service was good, we didn't have to wait for a table even though the place was bustling and the prices were reasonable.  Pyramid Cafe, increase your hours so people don't have to suffer at Raffles!!!

This restaurant offers overpriced and tasteless diner food that you can enjoy in a cloud of cigarette smoke from the casino floor that is twenty feet away. Trust me, it's definitely worth a trek outside of the hotel to find something else. We ordered the eggs benedict and corned beef and potatoes and I immediately got a stomach ache. Thanks, Pyramid!

This is your typical cafe/diner.  They serve breakfast food, burgers, and other things.  I ordered the skillet, which contained hash browns, cheese, eggs, and bacon.  The food took awhile to come.  They were not too busy, so I do not know why service was slow.  When it finally came, I was a little surprised because the skillet was so tiny.  It was about the size of my fist!  Regardless of its size, the skillet was actually pretty good.  The hash browns were crispy, and the cheese was nicely melted.  The bacon bits were mixed in really well.  

A little bit pricey for what I ordered, but all in all, I would recommend this place to people staying at the Luxor.  It is a shame that this place closes right after lunch.

Considering this restaurant is on the floor of a vegas casino, it is not too bad and not too pricey. I had a San Francisco Club, BLT with turkey and ham. Sandwich was good and fries were excellent, hot and crispy. My wife had the reuben, which was really good with plenty of corned beef (ratio with sauerkraut is very important). Sandwiches were 15 each. Coffee was drinkable, nothing special. Better coffee would have made this a 4-star review.

This place Sucks with a Capital S!!!!!! Negative 0 stars for this place!!!!!!! I didn't even get to try the food cuz they close at freaking one in the afternoon. I Mean What The F is up with that!!!!!!! What cafe closes right at lunch time and especially in Vegas????? That's where everything Is supposed to be open 24 hours right? ??? The workers there were so rude and told m e to come back at 5 om and it would be open till midnight so I came back at 10 pm for a late dinner and it was a freaking ghost town!!!!!!!! That stupid rude woman lied to me!!!! Ugh. That's OK though cuz I asked my sister if she ever ate there and she said that she ordered a BUT once and there was a dead roach in there!!!!! Ewwwwww!!!!!!!  This place should be shut down!!!!!! I am going to call the health department and get this sick ghetto place shut way the hell down!!!!!!!!!

Absolutely delicious  breakfast. Had the steak and eggs, the steak was something that tasted like it came out of a mid tier steak house. I was very very impressed. The staff was warm and friendly.

However, I guess it did take a touch too long for the food to come out since it wasn't super busy, and their bloody mary was of low quality.

I left with a full heart and a full stomach though.

I've had worse breakfast food at actual breakfast establishments. I got the vegetarian omelette and it was super fluffy and filling. The Cinnabon French toast was also great. Sweet and soft. 

Service was alright. Definitely doesn't deserve some of the two stars people were giving.

I always feel like places like this will be disapointing with entrees that sound good but dont deliver for the price or compared to surrounding restaurants, i did not get dispointed here. This place is pretty kick ass for a hotel restaurant. Had steak, nachos, ortega burger, and a few different sides. All of them were way better than expected and it's open 24 hours although they have a limited menu for late night.
The staff was extremely friendly and prompt.  Got seated for lunch right away. The food was good.....not great but definitely 3 stars for the food and 4 for the friendly staff.

This cafe was hardly full at 4 am, but somehow we ended up waiting like an hour for our food. When we got our food, half the orders were incorrect and when they did correct them, they sucked. I know when you are drunk and partying all night, you should be able to eat anything, but this was not the case with this joint. Waitress ignored our group most of the time.

Pyramid Cafe: My server was quick and friendly, and my food was okay (corned beef hash breakfast). My main concern was that 1/3 through my meal (an early weekday breakfast), my meal was interrupted by a violently-angry screaming match between a man and a woman in the kitchen / back area. I was wearing my headphones and watching a movie on my iPad and it was loud enough that I was pulled away from my show and meal and honestly quite startled. Other customers were also quite alarmed and very uncomfortable, and I (along with several others) left as quickly as I could.
Much better than your average cafe. Lots of choices, okay prices, service is good!

This was my experience this past Saturday.  We had a long wait to get in (I could overlook it).  The waitress rushes us to table, not letting me get a word in that we'd prefer a booth.  When she lets us get a word in she says "next time you should say before we sit you so you don't have to walk across the restaurant."  So despite there being over 10 booths open, she has us go wait by the register again.  We finally get a table.  The waiter is frazzled.  The meal was not the most delicious.  In fact, I wish we had gone to Denny's.  At least I wouldn't have been disappointed.  I never got my toast and our drinks were never refilled.  It took over 30 minutes to get our check and our change.  When we did get our change, we were short changed and had to go back to ask for our $5 they shorted us.  Will not visit again.  Save your money and go elsewhere.

My rating is 3.5 stars.

I remember telling my boyfriend that I was staying at a pyramid-shaped hotel and had breakfast at the Pyramid Cafe. He asked whether there were traditional Egyptian beans served at breakfast. As much as I would have loved an authentic Egyptian breakfast, this cafe is a cheaper alternative to eating at the buffet, especially for breakfast.

My friend and I headed over to this cafe for breakfast. It was busy, but there were plenty of tables for us when we got there.

I love corned beef hash. I got it with hashbrowns and scrambled eggs.

The food was hot and good. I am not crazy about crispy hashbrowns to the point where they can injure you if you threw them at someone. I'm not saying that you would, but they were too hard for my liking. 

Service was fine for how busy it gets. If you are in a rush, it's probably not the place for you. Otherwise, come here for a typical North American breakfast.

(171)

It might not be King Tut worthy, but it got the job done for me! There aren't a huge number of dining options at Luxor, and as a result I landed here. It is bright, spacious and clean, which is always a nice start to a meal. The menu has something for everyone I'm pretty sure; the service is quick, and the prices are reasonable. My choice: a simple soup and salad combo. The salad was mixed greens with basic vegetables, and the blue cheese dressing was just right. The tomato soup wasn't mind-blowing. It was a close relative to Campbell's. Nothing to be ashamed about. The only thing I truly missed was a basket of warm bread. Otherwise, an acceptable choice for when you're hungry, not looking for anything too fancy and you happen to be at the Luxor.

I was pleasantly surprised by this cafe. I went for breakfast and didn't have any high hopes. Thought it would be another buffet style. This was probably one of the first meals where I actually felt satisfied by the taste and money I was spending. Typical Vegas prices $10-15 meals. We both had omelets and the hash browns were great, so textured. Danny was our server and he was very nice and attentive.

Items selected:
Coffee
Biscuits and Jam
Monte Cristo - Battered and Griddled Black Forest Ham, Turkey, Swiss, Powdered Sugar, Strawberry Preserves with Hash Browns
Red Velvet Pancakes - Sweetened Cream Cheese and Chocolate Crumbles
Carrot Cake French Toast - Vanilla Cream Cheese Drizzle, Caramelized Nuts
Strawberry Shortcake French Toast - Lemon Poppy Seed Bread dipped in Vanilla Custard, Griddled, with Strawberries, Whipped Cream, and Strawberry Sauce
 
Located in Luxor, a casino I've not visited since establishing residence in Las Vegas, Pyramid Café was one of those All-Hours diners that I knew I'd eventually visit and with a friend and fellow blogger happy to meet up for an early breakfast the opportunity finally presented, a long walk through the parking lot and a short one through the casino landing us a table overlooking the expansive gaming floor where a craps table was already getting rowdy...or perhaps still rowdy from the night before.  Sprawling in size and comfortably spaced with a menu chock-a-block full of clever twists on breakfast favorites both sweet and savory it was to the pleasant service of a woman named Debbie that we were greeted and with the meal divided into two courses comprised of five items, including one from the mid-day menu, plus copious refills of coffee rarely would any part of the experience falter - a ninety minute visit tallying $65 all-in for one of the Strip's more innovative breakfasts.  Starting slightly savory before progressing to things far sweeter it was with the duo of three thin Red Velvet pancakes gussied up by tangy cream cheese icing and a custardy masterpiece of a Monte Cristo with fresh strawberry preserves that the meal began and although biscuits and hash browns proved somewhat uninspired as optional sides portions of each proved ample for the price.  Opting next to explore the section entitled "French Toast and Waffles" with a pair of the former the plates that arrived would prove even more impressive than round one; both "breads" actually sliced cakes dipped in custard and griddled golden, the carrot lacking much vegetable but rich with spice while the tangy poppy seed version served as base to the unbridled flavor of fresh strawberries in a dessert-come-breakfast take on a summertime favorite that should not be missed.

Portions were large, servers tried their best to provide good, fast service despite seeming understaffed.  The place is rather busy, probably b/c those who are staying at the Luxor are more isolated from the strip and dont have many choices for a quick bite to eat.

I did, however, enjoy the nachos (2x) and the SF club sandwich.

If you are staying at the Luxor, use the $10 off coupon. :)

The food here always hits the spot. The steak and eggs are good. The steak is always juicy and the hash browns and eggs are always good. They serve fresh squeezed Orange juice. The oatmeal and waffles are also good. Their burgers are okay, I've had better. Their menu is quite small and it's a bit expensive. I would like to give it a higher rating but they seem to under staff the place. You have to wait to be seated and half the place is empty. Then when you're seated the service is a toss up but most likely a bit slow. The food is good so I will continue to come here on Vegas trips.

If you're looking for cheap drinks, absolutely come here!!!!!! They were very "heavy handed" with the amount of alcohol they give you in the $5 mimosas and the $10 32 oz daiquiris. We got 2 mimosas, 2 daiquiris, and martini for under $40. My husband and I both got omelets that lacked flavor but I'd absolutely go back for the drinks and service.

Love this place...breakfast is delicious and lots of options. They are so fast and awesome service...Victor was the best...we have been here 2 times already and are coming back before we leave the Luxor...

Know what? The food here isn't half bad. I mean lets face it, there are literally over 1,000 places to eat in just a 1-2 mile radius; and they all rank from 1-5 stars. So it's hard to compare all these places on the strip to each other.

So lets say you are staying at the Luxor (Check) You don't feel like walking or waiting in the taxi line to go to another hotel (Check) and you want a decent breakfast but not fast food (Check). Come to Pyramid Café! Yes they are going to be overpriced for the meal you get (Duh) that's expected on the strip. But their food is actually pretty decent, which honestly surprised me. I ate here twice. I had the breakfast skillet ($12.99) with a side of pancakes ($8.99 ish) one morning. I can live without the pancakes *Blah* but the skillet was pretty darn good. I would eat it again. The next time I came I had the Country Benedict ($12.99) which was good as well. I would rate the food 4 stars. Service...ummm...although the servers were super nice, they were slow to take the order, and slow to bring the check. Yes both times they were super busy, buuuuuut, they were not on top of their game. I've been to several places that are busy ALL the time and in comparison the speed of the service at Pyramid Café wasn't the best. Period. But overall 3 stars for this Café. If I stay at the Luxor again I'll definitely will be eating here again.

Note- They only serve breakfast & lunch. They serve breakfast until closing (1pm) and serve lunch from 11am-1pm.

***Update Coming here twice 6 months later...I have decided this IS a 4 star place. I've never been disappointed with the breakfast! The food IS GOOD! And actually worth the wait!

What to say about the Pyramid Cafe. The experience was just 'meh'.

We ate here because we were staying at the Luxor and were too lazy to drive anywhere else. It was sort of last minute at 9pm so we settled. Even at 9pm the place was busy and we had to wait for a table.

When we sat down it took a while for a server to get to us. Everyone working there looked harried, stressed and overworked. When we finally got served our server was very nice and did the best she could to get around to us. Ironically there were several men standing around who looked like managers who werent doing much at all to assist the staff even though they clearly needed it. Also, I saw a server loudly complaining about a customer to the manager within earshot and sight of the entire dining area. This is such a pet peeve of mine.

The food was just ok. We ordered a Cobb salad and salmon burger. The Cobb salad was pretty boring and predictable. The salmon burger was alright, maybe slightly undercooked, pretty small and not terribly interested. 

If I had to do it all over again I would make the extra effort to find another place to eat. Our total bill came to around $28 which certainly wasnt worth what we ate.

Went in for breakfast,  got there about 830am and was seated right away.  I noticed the line started forming about 9am. The cafe didn't appear to seat a lot and tables are pretty close together.   I ordered the steak and eggs which comes with 2 eggs, shredded hash browns, toast and a NY strip.  The toast is brought to the table in a basket with everyone's selection.  Food was average.   Ok, if you are staying at the Luxor and don't feel like going far for breakfast.  My eggs were under cooked for my taste. I should have ordered them over medium so my whites would have been cooked more.  My steak was ordered medium rare but it came out medium well.  Flavor of the steak was good and it was tender.  The hash browns, had a crisp topping, but the inside was soggier than what I prefer.  The other dish ordered at my table was the corn beef hash and eggs.  It was a large portion of hash served and he said it was "ok". Food came out hot and fairly quickly.  The coffee server was quick with the coffee refills, otherwise service was slow.
Steak n eggs does the trick when not much else is open...especially for only $4 more than pretty much the same meal w/o a steak

It's a cafe and great for a cafe.  They have healthy options for food. The steal cut oatmeal, the plain yogurt, and coffee were very good.  Friendly staff.  Clean. Convenient for us because we stayed in the Luxor.

WhAt DiD YoU CaLL ThAt?

Roaming around... looking for a good place to sit down and enjoy a nice breakfast... my friends, husband and I stopped in here. Walking in seems like an ordinary dine-in restaurant (in a hotel), yet in VEGAS everything is most of the time known to be: outrageous, CrAzY expensive and extremely packed with decor. Well... not here, just waiting in line you notice a lot of different verities of cakes in a Look-See Glass from both ways.

So, as we were seated (waiting around 5-10 minutes at max) GREAT TIMING... I was browsing the menu, which I came upon a unique omelet Ive never seen else were. CHILI CHEESE OMELET for BREAKFAST?!? Yup, as crazy as I may seem (EARLY IN THE MORNING) I choose that as a start off of a GREAT DAY AHEAD OF ME. Honestly, I could have counted to 200 and been notified that my food was ready.

Eating my CHILI CHEESE OMELET... it was FANTASTIC! It was made of egg (your normal egg omelet) which had green peppers inside and full of chili. DELICIOUS!

I highly recommend everyone to stop by and ask for the Chili Cheese Omelet early in the morning.

B+
4 STARS
Stayed at the luxor and ate at this cafe three times the food was perfect way better than what you would expect and you have to try the monte cristo!

After a night of dancing and drinking at Cathouse, we opted to find the closest place for after clubbin' grubbin'. We found the PC.

Because it was so late, there was no wait for a table and we were directed to a large table for our party. 

I was craving carbs and protein, so decided to split the steak and eggs. Comes with a side of hash browns. The food was decent. Decent enough to curb my hunger and soak up the alcohol.

Our service was great. Very nice and accommodating.

Cant Believe I Have Never Written A Review For This Place!! I Love Coming Here,Everytime Im In Vegas I Eat Here At Least Once For Breakfast! The Staff Is So Amazing!! The Food Comes Hot And Fresh And You Get Great Portions For The Price! You Can Also Give Them Your M Life Card To Earn Tier Credits For Every Dollar You Spend, Thank You For An Awesome Experience Everytime!

I don't care how you dress this place up, its still a fake Denny's. I know a Denny's when im in a Denny's and this is a damn Denny's called the Pyramid Cafe at the Luxor.

Stop Lying Vegas! Stop Lying!

I may have been extremely hungry when going here, plus we went for breakfast, and for whatever reason I was on a breakfast kick when we were on our honeymoon, but this was my favorite place we ate out of 5 days in Vegas.

I had breakfast sandwich slider type things:  fluffy biscuits, eggs, bacon (maybe tomatoes?  Don't remember)...pretty basic, but the ingredients were in perfect proportion.  The meal was filling but not the gigantic proportions I came to accept as normal in Vegas, not to the point where I felt uncomfortable for the rest of my day.

Especially if you're staying at the Luxor, make sure to go have breakfast here one morning!
Every time I wanted to go there they were closed! This place should be 24hrs, not closed certain sections of time.

Went here for breakfast because Excalibur sucks big time. Food was good with large portions . Wait staff was nice. A bit pricey but served as breakfast & lunch for us because of big portion sizes, so worth it. Breakfast for 5 people was a $100 including tip.

Kinda reminded me of a diner. We were seated right away. The place wasn't very busy but it took a long time for our food to come. Their fruit plate was beautiful. Blackberries were HUGE!! The Cinnamon Roll French Toast was good; very filling. The service was pretty good too, other than the wait for the food to come.

We were looking for a place to eat. (we were starving...big time and trying to pass time before the Criss Angel show (i will write a review about the show later...i have a lot to say.)  

So we ended up at the Pyramid Cafe.  Located in the Luxor.  It was during happy hour so we did the happy hour menu.  We ended up getting chicken wings (nothing spectacular), steak and vegetable (nothing spectacular) , and some dip.  I can't remember exactly what it was.  I guess it proves to show that this place was... "A-OK."  

It did fill me up and I was ready for the show.  

Service was so-so.  The waitress was nice but it took a while for the food to come.  

It's ok.  I'll probably go there again if I have too.

Cute place! Very basic breakfast dishes for reasonable prices. The food was okay- the waffles my friend ordered were much more tasty than what I ordered! 

Even though the cafe was extremely busy, our server was very attentive and kept coming by to ensure we were enjoying our meal and well taken care of. So great service!

I ate here twice on my recent trip to Las Vegas.  Breakfast was okay, but avoid the waffles unless you like them dry and tasteless.  Go with the pancakes.  Grilled cheese sandwich was okay -- not the best, but not a greasy mess either.  Avoid the nachos.  They were so bad the waitress had them removed from my bill.  French onion soup -- you take your life in your own hands if you eat the Durkee fried onion pieces on top.

Servers are pleasant.  They are great with refilling your Pepsi-product beverages.  The cafe is clean.  You could bring a large group here and no one would mind.  Its a good pit stop for a snack, not a gormet meal.

Convenience was what got this one 3 stars. The food was good, the prices were outrageous for anywhere else in the western hemisphere but down right cheap for Vegas, and it was convenient and open at all G*d awful hours that we were awake.

When you go into a 24 hour cafe in Vegas you will definitely expect the worst. I know I sure was when I came in here. 

The pyramid cafe will surprise you, I actually got what i thought was a pretty good french dip sandwich and I was not under the influence one bit!

The chicken pot pie was pretty terrible here, but my buddy should have known better then to order that I guess. 

Stick to the bar food type stuff here and you will do fine.

It's a nice, casual restaurant. I came here for breakfast with a friend. We both had omlettes with juice. I think they made it with Velveta cheese...anyway...

Service was very slow because they were short handed. Our waitress only showed up to take the order and drop the check. Someone else delivered our order. 

The food was pretty good. Priced a bit on the high side for breakfast (but, I'm cheap).

I would probably come here again if I wasn't going to visit other places on The Strip.
Want try good early morning breakfast. Come to this place in Vegas on of the best in town..

I ate here with my wife to stock up on food before entering the Cathouse to open Spring Break with a bang at the Welcome to Fabulous Yelp Vegas party.  Big mistake, because the chicken treats never stopped coming once we were inside Cathouse!  But at least our leisurely dinner was very enjoyable when we ate it.

French Onion Soup was rather weird looking with crispy onion straws strewn all over the soup's Swiss Cheese top.  But it all melted nicely and tasted hot, cheesy, very oniony, and satisfying as this comfort food should.  Red Skin-on Potato Salad was nice and cold, with pretty hard but tasty potato chunks, egg, celery, and green onions.  Creamy Cole Slaw with carrot slivers was very good, except not as cold as I would have preferred.  

A very good and big Monte Cristo sandwich was the highlight of my meal.  I got both powdered sugar and Strawberry Sauce refills to keep the sandwich of hot ham, smoked turkey, and melted cheese sweet and well lubricated.  The divine sauce even contained ripe half strawberries in it.  Diane enjoyed her Fish & Chips, and caused me to chuckle as she began to dip her fries in the extra powdered sugar supplied on request.  Service was excellent and attentive, and included several unrequested Iced Tea refills.

This was a definite 4-1/2 star experience!

This place is almost like Dennys, but it is seats way more people. I had the All-American Breakfast with ham and portion sizes are incredible. The ham is HUGE, too large to my liking as it was too dry. The fried potatoes were a little burnt. I had my eggs scrambled, okay but nothing special. 

I would have given Pyramid Cafe 2 stars for the food, but the service was quite exceptional so I gave them 3 stars.

Bad, overpriced food.

The breakfast platter is not good. I think the scrambled eggs are made of powdered eggs - they are barely edible. The bacon is greasy, although the hashbrowns and pancakes are OK.

The oatmeal is fine. The greek yogurt berry parfait is surprisingly OK, although the fruit is frozen rather than fresh.

The service is slow. The restaurant itself is clean and simple enough, but I will not be back.

This place has horrible costumer service.  I'm not sure how the food taste.  After sitting there for 15 minutes with no waitress (I even flagged one down and she told me to wait).  Needless to say I walked out.  Lastly, the menu is pretty expensive (breakfast and a drink).  You might as well do the MORE buffet.

It was late and we found ourselves at the Luxor and looking for a late dinner. The Pyramid Café is open 24 hours and looked appealing with its half circle banquettes and view of the bustling casino.

I ordered a favorite I hadn't had in years, a Monte Cristo ($11.95) sandwich.  It was served with ample amounts of ham, turkey and cheese and cooked to the proper golden brown along with a very nice strawberry preserve.  The sandwich was good, but the French toast could have been better.  

My wife had the California Turkey Panini topped with cheese, avocado and tomato ($11.95) served on a ciabatta roll.  Tasty enough but not pressed or grilled in any manner.  Huh, what's up with that?  We saw another patron get served the same thing and watched the quizzical look on his face as he lifted the top of the uncooked roll.   

Is the "press" in the kitchen on the fritz or the executive chef doesn't know that most people expect a grilled Panini when that word (we're not in Italy) is used.   Now that I think about it, how can you press a sandwich with tomato and avocado on it?   Maybe they should rename it the warm Pyramid Café turkey sandwich. 

Next time I'll go with the all day breakfast.
We have dined here many times during our stays at both Mandalay Bay & Luxor.  Our go to favorite is the nachos.  Great service each time. Large portions.  Great cheescake.

Open air eatery so no real decor. Table and chairs for 4. Food wasn't good at all and the waitress never bothered to check on us. Had enough comps to cover the cost of breakfast so at least we weren't out any money. We won't be back.

We went here Sunday after mass. I had the steak and eggs with hash browns and a blue berry muffin.

Steak was dry and lacked taste.
Eggs were just as dry.
Hash browns were just okay.
Blue berry muffin was falling apart and tasted like a pre-packaged as opposed to fresh as it was very wet.

Sitting alone with a pyramid of creamers (27 of em, I counted), without a crowd, without a buffet line-up, I experienced fair prices in peace, with lovely and attentive service.

Toast is served in a basket, a glass of water large enough and fit for a King; and good, strong coffee (priced too high, a flippin $3.50 - I could so lose that kind of dinero in a slot machine!).

The menu has a nice amount of selections, and a great alternative to the buffet.

Good for a late night snack after gambling the night away, but even better for breakfast! Service was good, and food is even better! Asked for my steak rare and it came out that way! My hubby asked if he could have a ham steak instead and they grilled it deliciously! We ate here every day.

The food was good, but the service SUX.  We went with a 5.00 off a 40.00 check.  The bill came to 38.00, so I said " lets take a piece of cake to go, since its basically free with the coupon.  I asked for one kind of cake, I ended up with a totally different kind.  It took about 20 min to get the cake.  Ridiculous.  The food was decent though, my partner and I shared a salad( overpriced at 7,00) and a chicken pot pie( huge and a decent deal at 12.99).  The pie was loaded with chunks of white chicken in a creamy sauce.  Pastry was good.  The corn muffin it came with was so freaking dry.  I asked for some bread instead.  My partners dad had a club and it was large with plenty of fries.  He enjoyed that.  

Oh, I wanted to take something "to go" from here.  I called while I was in my room and was told I'd have to wait on line to be seated and then order from a waitress and then I could take it to go.  Whats the point in that?

Yummy breakfast! My wife and I loved it.

I had pancakes and eggs with sausage and my wife had yummy chicken and waffles. 

The waitresses were so friendly and nice. Cute older ladies. And they kept our cups full of juice and coffee.

Over all it was a wonderful, cozy, warm restaurant for breakfast or lunch.
